What are the benefits of holding Pure, and how does it relate to conversions between VRSC and tBTC?

Holding Pure, an Automated Market Maker (AMM) currency, offers several benefits. One of the main advantages is that Pure accrues conversion fees. When users convert between Pure, VRSC, and tBTC, they pay a small conversion fee, which is then divided in half. One half of the conversion fee stays in the Pure reserves, increasing the value of Pure because no new Pure is minted. This mechanism ensures that the value of Pure is constantly appreciating.

The conversions themselves are MEV-resistant and verified by the miners and stakers of the protocol, adding an extra layer of security and trust to the system. Additionally, users can create subIDs, which cost a small amount of tBTC.vETH in Pure. These costs are burned, reducing the overall circulation of Pure, which in turn increases its value.

It's also important to note that conversions between VRSC and tBTC are only possible after a preconversion period has ended. During this period, users can fund the reserves of Pure with VRSC and tBTC, and in return, they receive a fair share of the initial supply of Pure.

The initial supply of Pure was fixed at 20,000, but after the initial distribution, the supply became dynamic. When users convert from VRSC or tBTC into Pure, new Pure is minted, and when they convert from Pure back to VRSC or tBTC, the Pure is burned. This dynamic supply mechanism ensures that the value of Pure is constantly being adjusted based on market demand.

Overall, holding Pure provides a unique opportunity to benefit from conversion fees and appreciate in value over time, making it an attractive option for users within the Verus ecosystem.
